SEARCH
Package com.weather.sdk.cache

Class DefaultWeatherCache

java.lang.Object
com.weather.sdk.cache.DefaultWeatherCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
WeatherCache
public class DefaultWeatherCache extends Object implements WeatherCache
Default implementation of the WeatherCache interface with LRU eviction and TTL support.

This class provides a thread-safe cache for weather data with the following features:

  • LRU Eviction: When cache reaches maximum size, automatically evicts the least recently used entry
  • TTL Support: Each cache entry has a configurable time-to-live and automatically expires after the TTL duration
  • Thread Safety: All operations are thread-safe and can be called concurrently by multiple threads
  • Cache Key Normalization: City names are normalized to lowercase, trimmed format for consistent lookup

Implementation Details: This implementation uses a LinkedHashMap with access-order enabled for LRU eviction. The removeEldestEntry() method automatically removes the least recently used entry when the cache exceeds maximum size. All public methods are synchronized to ensure thread safety.

Usage Example

 // Create cache with max 100 cities and 10-minute TTL
 WeatherCache cache = new DefaultWeatherCache(Duration.ofMinutes(10), 100);

 // Store weather data
 WeatherData weatherData = createWeatherDataFor("London");
 cache.put("London", weatherData);

 // Retrieve weather data
 Optional<WeatherData> cached = cache.get("London");
 if (cached.isPresent()) {
   System.out.println("Cached weather: " + cached.get());
 }

 // Check cache size
 int currentSize = cache.size();
Since:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultWeatherCache

      public DefaultWeatherCache(Duration ttl, int maxSize)
      Constructs a new DefaultWeatherCache with the specified parameters.

      This constructor creates a LinkedHashMap with access-order enabled for LRU eviction. When the cache reaches maximum size, the least recently accessed entry is automatically removed.

      Parameters:
      ttl - the time-to-live for cached entries (must not be null or non-positive)
      maxSize - the maximum number of cities to cache (must be positive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ttl is null, negative, or zero, or if maxSize is not positive

  • Method Details

    • get

      public Optional<WeatherData> get(String cityName)
      Retrieves weather data for the specified city from the cache.

      This method performs TTL expiration checks and automatically removes expired entries. The access order is updated for LRU eviction when a valid entry is accessed.

      Specified by:
      get in interface WeatherCache
      Parameters:
      cityName - the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the cached weather data if found and valid, or Optional.empty() if not found or expired

    • put

      public void put(String cityName, WeatherData weatherData)
      Stores weather data for the specified city in the cache.

      This method records the current timestamp for TTL calculation. The LinkedHashMap automatically handles LRU eviction when the cache exceeds maxSize.

      Specified by:
      put in interface WeatherCache
      Parameters:
      cityName - the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
      weatherData - the weather data to cache (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if weatherData is null

    • evict

      public void evict(String cityName)
      Evicts (removes) the weather data entry for the specified city from the cache.

      This method removes the entry if it exists. If the entry doesn't exist, this operation has no effect.

      Specified by:
      evict in interface WeatherCache
      Parameters:
      cityName - the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all entries from the cache.

      This method removes all cached weather data and resets the cache to its initial state. After this operation, size() will return 0.

      Specified by:
      clear in interface WeatherCache

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the current number of entries in the cache.

      This includes both valid (non-expired) and expired entries that haven't been cleaned up yet. Expired entries are automatically removed during get() operations.

      Specified by:
      size in interface WeatherCache
      Returns:
      the current number of entries in the cache

    • getAllCachedCities

      public Set<String> getAllCachedCities()
      Returns a set of all cached city names.

      This method provides access to all city names currently in the cache, which is useful for operations like polling all cached cities.

      Specified by:
      getAllCachedCities in interface WeatherCache
      Returns:
      a set of all cached city names (normalized to lowercase)
